page.title: 02FARMING, NORTH WEST FELTWELL
page.content: To the North of Feltwell the chalk subsoil provides a thin light soil which grows cereal crops and sugar beet with some potatoes. The farms are located in the village and are generally in the hands of owner occupiers, some of whose ancestors have farmed in the village for several generations. To the West of the Cut off Channel the soil is capable of growing a wide variety of vegetable crops including carrots, celery, and green beans as well as cereals,potatoes and beet. The latest technology and farming methods have a strong hold in the area which has only been in full production since World War Two Here farms are in the hands of large partnerships, transfer of land taking place as investments.
